I didn't really wanna put this under the recent thread titled "Is using car tires on a motorcycle safe?", but in my mind I am appending this to that thread (203 posts long at this moment).
https://www.motorcycleforum.com/threads/is-using-car-tires-safe.252243/#post-2747145
Go there for pages and pages of back-and-forth discussion of it.

This is here because Joel the mole recently posted a photo that clearly explained to me why someone would do "that" to their motorcycle. If my riding environment or style wore my rear motorcycle tire like that one pictured here, I can imagine making the same choice.

Of course I went far out of my way to live where the roads are not straight... and the people are ... ðŸ”¥

As a lifetime G-force-junkie, the corners are everything ... straightaways are necessary evils that connect them. I strive to get my money's-worth from the entire tire construction, and for me said design must include high-G cornering as a major priority.
